Player History
Signed as a free agent by New York (A) on 4/1/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $1,028,000 per year...
Traded from New York (Y) to San Diego on 5/18/1985 (Going to SD: P Phil Niekro, P Al Leiter, P Doug Drabek, RF Don Baylor. Going to NYY: P LaMarr Hoyt, P Gene Walter, P Rich Gossage, CF Shane M
ack, RF Tony Gwynn)...
Injured on 5/13/1986 with a Sore Back, out for one week...
Had first career hit (double) on 5/28/1988, off Sid Fernandez (NYM)...
Earned first career win on 6/2/1988...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 10/1/1989, going 3-0, 1.05...
Won Cy Young Award in 1989, going 17-7, 2.17 ERA...
Injured on 3/4/1990 with a Ruptured Elbow Ligament, out for 9 weeks...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
2/2/1991: Gets a new one-year contract worth $4,871,429 through salary arbitration...
5/3/1991: Signed a contract extension with San Diego, $6,330,000 per year, for 3 years.
Hit first career homerun on 6/23/1991, off Kevin Appier (CIN)...
Was selected to the 1991 Allstar game...
Injured on 10/1/1991 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Won World Series with San Diego in 1991...
Was selected to the 1992 Allstar game...
